abstracts.cdata!:
The Wider Caribbean Initiative for Ship
            Generated Solid Wastes Project is conceived as the first
            phase of a longer term process of cleaning up and protecting
            the Caribbean Sea. The objective of this first phase program
            is to provide the basis for ratification and implementation
            of the International Convention for the Prevention of
            Pollution from Ships (MARPOL 73/78) by the Developing
            Countries of the Wider Caribbean Region (DCWCR). The project
            will finance consultant services and their logistical
            support to: 1) assess existing legislation and regulations
            of the DCWCR; 2) identify legal remedies available under
            international agreements to comply with regulations; 3)
            assess existing waste management systems in the DCWCR; 4)
            formulate regional engineering criteria for waste reception
            facilities at the ports; 5) coordinate discussion with
            shipping and cruise lines on reducing waste; 6) develop
            integrated waste management alternatives; 7) develop
            strategies for the integration of collection, treatment and
            disposal of ship-generated waste; 8) assist ports in
            defining the appropriate tariffs for receiving wastes; 9)
            develop proposals to ensure that DCWCR achieves full cost
            recovery of the collection; 10) develop strategies for
            public awareness programs; 11) brief potential donors,
            financing institutions, and nongovernmental organizations on
            the status of MARPOL 73/78; and 12) based on the success of
            the project, develop a strategy for expanding benefits to
            other areas.
